\subsection{Detailed Description}
A string type designed for storing and manipulating U\+T\+F-\/8 encoded text. 

\begin{DoxyNote}{Note}
This object expects input text to already be U\+T\+F-\/8 encoded. For functions to convert encodings see \hyperlink{_unicode_util_8hpp}{Unicode\+Util.\+hpp}
\end{DoxyNote}
The \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1str_1_1_u_t_f8_string}{U\+T\+F8\+String} data type is used extensively throughout Chaos\+Core and other Chaos Foundation projects.

Chaos\+Core stands by the principle that all string handling should be Unicode aware. The {\ttfamily char} primitive should only be used for storing and manipulation raw byte data, not for representing entire language characters. Furthermore Chaos\+Core considers U\+T\+F-\/8 to be the only accepted standard encoding for Unicode. Other encodings should only be used for special cases or interacting with other applications that require a different encoding (such as the Windows A\+P\+I). For more see \href{http://utf8everywhere.org/}{\tt http\+://utf8everywhere.\+org/}

For practicality the internal byte of U\+T\+F8\+Strings is N\+U\+L\+L terminated. This means the raw data can easily be used as native c strings.

\begin{DoxyParagraph}{A Brief Introduction to U\+T\+F-\/8}
In order to fully make use of the \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1str_1_1_u_t_f8_string}{U\+T\+F8\+String} functionality its useful to understand the U\+T\+F-\/8 encoding method.
\end{DoxyParagraph}
U\+T\+F-\/8 encodes each Unicode symbol in 1-\/4 bytes. The value of each symbol maps directly to a Unicode code point that represents the symbol. For example\+:


\begin{DoxyItemize}
\item \char`\"{}a\char`\"{} is stored within one byte with the hex value 0x61 or binary value {\ttfamily 0110 0001}
\item \char`\"{}ל\char`\"{} is stored within two bytes with the hex value 0x\+D79\+C or binary value {\ttfamily 1101 0111 1001 1100}
\item \char`\"{}∑\char`\"{} is stored within three bytes with the hex value 0x\+E28891 or binary value {\ttfamily 1110 0010 1000 1000 1001 0001} 
\end{DoxyItemize}

Assigns the internal data of this \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1str_1_1_u_t_f8_string}{U\+T\+F8\+String} to the given string literal. 

This operation will delete any current internal data of this object. The input data is expected to be utf-\/8 encoded. This function should be used when the input data is not N\+U\+L\+L terminated, or can be used for optimisation purposes if the length of data is already known. This will mean the length of the data will not need to be evaluated internally.

\subsubsection[{get\+\_\+byte\+\_\+length() const }]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}size\+\_\+t chaos\+::str\+::\+U\+T\+F8\+String\+::get\+\_\+byte\+\_\+length (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
{}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
) const}\label{classchaos_1_1str_1_1_u_t_f8_string_a9312a6aac333d68a87066d6f222d119a}


Gets the length of the internal buffer data in bytes. 

This is exactly the number of bytes in the internal raw data of this \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1str_1_1_u_t_f8_string}{U\+T\+F8\+String} which can be accessed through get\+\_\+raw\+\_\+data(). Note that this data is N\+U\+L\+L (\textquotesingle{}\textbackslash{}0\textquotesingle{}) terminated and this length includes the N\+U\+L\+L terminator. Therefore if \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1str_1_1_u_t_f8_string}{U\+T\+F8\+String} == \char`\"{}\char`\"{} then \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1str_1_1_u_t_f8_string_a9312a6aac333d68a87066d6f222d119a}{get\+\_\+byte\+\_\+length()} == 1.

\begin{DoxyNote}{Note}
This is not equal to the character length of the string as utf-\/8 encoded characters can take up multiple bytes.
\end{DoxyNote}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
The length of the internal data. 
\end{DoxyReturn}
\hypertarget{classchaos_1_1str_1_1_u_t_f8_string_a387abdce2189a379961844cd0a42a97a}{}\index{chaos\+::str\+::\+U\+T\+F8\+String@{chaos\+::str\+::\+U\+T\+F8\+String}!get\+\_\+byte\+\_\+width@{get\+\_\+byte\+\_\+width}}

/brief Return the length of this \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1str_1_1_u_t_f8_string}{U\+T\+F8\+String}

The length is defined how many utf-\/8 symbols there are in the string, this length doesn\textquotesingle{}t not necessarily equal the byte length of the string.

\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
The number of utf-\/8 symbols in this \hyperlink{classchaos_1_1str_1_1_u_t_f8_string}{U\+T\+F8\+String}. 
\end{DoxyReturn}
